direction.raw_text: The sultry dampness of a blistering summer hangs in the night air. People stroll the boardwalk looking for a cool breeze. The soft rhythms of a jazz concert float from the band shell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and a woman's shapely legs, walking along the wooden pier. OPENING TITLES & CREDITS OVER. After several steps, a discarded piece of gum sticks to one of her shoes, stretching out stickily. Two steps later, a piece of paper sticks to the gum, flopping awkwardly with each step. The MOVING CAMERA PANS UP her gorgeous legs and sensuous body. She wears a loose summer dress that floats like gossamer around her soft curves. Her hair is long and blond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stops at the railing. We see an incredibly beautiful face and cool, alluring eyes. This is LOLA CAIN. The term "femme fatale" was coined for her. She's on display... and knows it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CAMERA MOVES with her as she walks on, passing TWO MEN whose eyes are glued to her. We HOLD ON THEM. One is NED RAVINE, in his thirties, stalwart, handsome, hair trimmed neatly, but with a feel of loose ends about him... coat slung over his shoulder, sleeves rolled up, the sweat dampening his shirt. He's a cop. A plain clothes detective who's been around the block a few times and still gets lost. Next to him is ARCH, his partner. Older, if not in years, at least in mileage. Dependable, solid, with no great aspirations except to reach the end of a shift intact. He's eating Nachos from a cardboard container, licking the cheese off his fingers. The CAMERA PUSHES IN to NED. His eyes are fixed on Lola.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) To some guys, women are like a cheap puzzle... with pieces that just don't fit. They think the soul of a woman is darker than a back alley... more tangled than a telephone cord... and colder than a Klondike Bar in Canada. But those guys don't even have a clue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) When you know women the way I do, you understand exactly what what makes them tick... what makes them hum... what makes them jiggle up and down when they walk. And it's not the kind of thing you can learn from a correspondence course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NED'S POV She walks to the other side of the pier... as more paper sticks to the gum on her shoe. She stands at the railing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) There are two kinds of women in this world... and I've known 'em both.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arch heaves an exasperated sigh and looks toward Ned. The CAMERA PULLS BACK to INCLUDE NED. It isn't "voice-over" narration at all. Ned is actually talking out loud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the b.g., MILO CRUMLEY, the "Support Hose Bandit", ambles by casually, unnoticed, sucking on a cherry Snow-Cone through the panty-hose pulled down over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pops the last chip in his mouth, licks his fingers and turns the container over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned shakes his head. Arch heads off to the Nacho stand. Ned steps over to the railing... gazes out at the ocean.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) One will take you for a fast ride on a bumpy road with no seat belt. But the other kind...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupts) Jeez... knock off the chatter, will ya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just trying to keep you awake, Arch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm awake! Where do you come up with all that crap about women?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's true. Women are very complex, but if you know how to read 'em... they're an open book. You can always tell the rotten apples from the peaches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you kiddin'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd stake my career on it. Anybody ever proves me wrong, I'll throw away my badge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aayyhh... women are trouble...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I used to believe that too. Until I married Lana. Now, she... is a peach.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well you're a lucky stiff, pal. Ya hold down two jobs. Got a beautiful wife waitin' for ya at home. Everything a guy could ever want, including NO kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd love to have kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?! Rug-rats? Give me a break! (looks around) Jeez, I hate stakeouts. What makes you think Milo's gonna show up here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Logic. He knocked off all those banks. He's got cash. He's gonna want to spend it. This is one of the few places that still takes cash. Sooner or later... he's gotta turn up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And how we s'posed to recognize this scumbag?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The "Support Hose Bandit"? When you see him... you'll know him.

dialogue.raw_text: These are the best damn Nachos in North America. Maybe the world!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm empty. I'm gonna get a refill. You want some?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: begins to wail a scorching, romantic melody... a recurrent tune that will come to be known as LOLA'S THEME. A beat later... Lola moves to Ned's side at the railing. He tries to ignore her presence, peering into the darkness. Lola digs in her purse for a pack of cigarettes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned pulls out a small flashlight, shines it in her purse. She pulls a cigarette out of the pack, puts it to her lips... her eyes on Ned, sizing him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls out a handful of matchbooks, shows her, then stuffs them back in his pocket. He turns and walks along the pier. She falls into step beside him, lighting her own cigarette. A saxophone player named DIZZY follows behind them, continuing to play. He's the actual source of the romantic THEME MUSIC we've been hearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola looks toward a nearby hot dog vendor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola turns to the hot dog VENDOR, raising two fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes them... hands one to Ned. He picks up the plastic mustard container to put mustard on her hot dog first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned REACTS to this, squeezing the container. A stream of mustard squirts out, hitting the front of Lola's dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flustered, he stuffs his hot dog into his inside jacket pocket, then tries to wipe the mustard off Lola's dress, smearing it all over her, making it worse. She watches him with a cool, detached gaze as he fumbles ingenuously. Suddenly, Ned stops, looking off. He sees... Milo Crumley going into the PUBLIC RESTROOM. Ned starts to leave. Lola grabs his hand, holding it tightly against her breast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heads for the men's room... signaling to Arch, who's waiting in line at the Nacho stand. Arch motions at the long line... all UNIFORMED COPS... shrugging helplessly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You sound so sure of yourself.

direction.raw_text: Several MEN are at the urinals. Milo, still wearing the panty hose over his head, washes his face at the sink. He looks up, sees Ned enter. Ned sees Milo... reacts, pulling the frankfurter out of his pocket and pointing it.

direction.raw_text: The Men turn, seeing Ned pointing the frankfurter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo bolts, slamming into Ned, knocking him back through the door of a stall, into the lap of the MAN inside.

dialogue.raw_text: Hold it right there, Milo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look out! He's got a weenie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Milo bursts out, colliding with Arch. They both go down in a flurry of Nacho chips and cheese. Arch helps Milo to his feet, apologizing profusely... picking up the gun that Milo dropped, handing it back to him. Milo sprints off down the pier. A beat later, Ned bursts out the door... dashing after Milo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo runs frantically, knocking people aside! He ducks into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and drags a FLUSTERED MAN out of a bumper car, jumps in, and speeds away! A beat later, Ned runs up, followed by Arch. Ned flashes his badge at a FRECKLE-FACED KID in one of the bumper cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls the kid out, jumps in, slaps a portable FLASHING RED LIGHT on the dashboard... then speeds off after Milo, a SIREN WAILING! He zig-zags through the crush of other bumper cars in the pavilion. Ned's bumper car catches up with Milo, pulling alongside. Milo turns the wheel, RAMMING Ned! Ned RAMS him back, both bumper cars swerving violently... spraying SPARKS! Ned SLAMS Milo's car again! Milo loses control, spins out and SMASHES into the pavillion railing! Ned swerves to avoid a collision, but RAMS into two other bumper cars, wrenching to a grinding halt. A BEAT. The AIRBAG inflates in his bumper car. Arch runs up as Ned pulls himself from the wreckage. They turn to see Milo leap from his mangled bumper car, leap over the pavillion railing and dash down the pier and into an alley between two buildings. A sign on the building says: DEAD END ALLEY. Ned and Arch eye each other, shake their heads, and follow after Milo.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Police emergency! I need your car!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.

direction.raw_text: Milo runs into a tall chain link fence at the end of the alley and scrambles up the wire mesh. Suddenly, Ned's hand shoots out, grabs Milo's ankle, yanking him down hard. Milo jumps to his feet, swinging at Ned, who catches Milo's fist with his hand, stopping it cold... neatly snapping a handcuff on his wrist. He shoves Milo's arm against the fence and snaps the other cuff to the chainlink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flashes out of Milo's other hand with a sharp CLICK! Milo slashes the blade at Ned, just missing his face. On the backswing, Ned parries with his own switchblade and flips Milo's knife away. Milo pulls a .45 Calibre REVOLVER with his free hand! Ned shoves his finger into the end of the barrel. Milo looks surprised... then sneers, clicking the hammer back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo hesitates, unsure. Finally, he releases the gun. Ned raises it up on the end of his finger. Arch pulls it off with a loud POP! Ned cuffs Milo's hands behind him... spins him around.

dialogue.raw_text: Then you're probably not familiar with the theory of inverse proportionate explosive dynamics.

dialogue.raw_text: What about it?

dialogue.raw_text: If you fire a weapon with the barrel obstructed, the explosive force multiplies by twenty-three point five nine eight and reverses on itself with diametric polarity?

dialogue.raw_text: The gun will blow up in your hand... and it won't even scorch my pinkie.

direction.raw_text: The CAMERA MOVES up the stairs, into the bedroom. Still O.S., we hear more heavy breathing... urgent whispers... lust... passion... squeaky bedsprings! A trail of clothes is scattered before us on the way to the bed... shoes, a dress, slip, bra, nylons, panties... greasy coveralls with a "Frank Kelbo - Mobile Mechanic" namepatch, dirty work boots, a wrench and a gigantic grease gun... The bed shakes violently. A female VOICE calls the shots as various tools drop to the floor.

direction.raw_text: A beat. The LIGHT clicks ON. LANA; a sexy redhead with a cool, manipulative edge, and FRANK; a slick, smarmy Lothario, lay under the sheets, panting, glistening with sweat. Lana reaches for a pack of "Fatal 100's" on the bedside table.

Stabilize your ball joints and grind my rear differential! (CLINK! Screwdriver) Now accelerate! Floor it! Lay rubber, baby! VRRROOOOOOOOOOMMMMMMMMM!

A headline on the cover touts an article: "LIFE INSURANCE FOR YOUR CAT!... Cover All Nine Lives For The Price of One!" Ned's smile fades.

direction.raw_text: Ned turns to Lana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lana tenses up at this. Frank freezes. He figures they've been busted. He sits there, holding the magazine, not moving a muscle... as Ned turns on him.

direction.raw_text: Lana braces herself against the sink, breathless... turned on by Ned's description. Ned goes to her, sympathetic.

direction.raw_text: He goes to kiss her mouth and she turns her cheek to him. He looks at her lovingly... touches her face tenderly.

Frank sweeps the dishes off the table with his arm. Lana leaps into his arms, wrapping her legs around his waist. He lays her down on the kitchen table, standing over her. Suddenly, Ned opens the back door, glaring right at Frank... not even noticing Lana on the table.

direction.raw_text: Richly appointed with stately oak, walls lined with law books. As in all "Noir" thrillers, venetian blinds cast dramatic slashes of light and ceiling fans turn lazily in every room. Ned hurries in, rummaging through the files on his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a strikingly lovely brunette, enters from the outer office, files in hand. She is Ned's astute, dedicated, self- sacrificing "girl-friday" and legal secretary. She keeps his life from spinning crazily apart. She absolutely adores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She picks up a lawbook, flips it open to a dog-eared page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles gratefully... drops the file into his briefcase. Ned heads for the office washroom. Laura darts ahead of him into the washroom and turns the water on. Ned steps in... splashes some water on his face. Laura grabs a towel from the rack where three small towels hang neatly... hands it to Ned. He dries his face, looking at her with genuine fondness and gratitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She glances toward the toilet, notices it hasn't been flushed. She FLUSHES it, lowers the seat.

direction.raw_text: She sits down on the toilet seat, watching him adoringly as he shaves with an electric razor.

direction.raw_text: Laura neatly folds the end of the toilet paper into a point.

They are all straight and even... except one, whose tall branches tower conspicuously above the rest. He holds up a chainsaw, nodding toward the trees. Shaking and tearful... she backs into the house.

direction.raw_text: out in terror! Ned rushes in, shaking her.

He walks along, looking at thirty exactly identical blue suits, hanging neatly. Laura follows behind him. He stops and stares, indecisive.

dialogue.raw_text: Things just don't look the same. It's fuzzy... and frightening!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The nylon pantyhose are draped over the frightened face of a WOMAN JUROR. All the other Jurors are holding up their own socks and nylon stockings, trying to peer through them. Ned steps over to Milo, motioning toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo unwraps a piece of bubble gum and pushes it into his panty-hose covered mouth, chewing the nylon and gum together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned motions toward the gallery, where we SEE... ...MILO'S WIFE and TWO CHILDREN, all wearing panty hose over their faces. Ned motions toward Milo.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen... Milo Crumley is not the perpetrator here. He is the VICTIM!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like ALL of us... this man is the unfortunate victim of these tragically difficult economic times. And what does that mean? He can't support his family!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For God's sake!... He can't even support his own FACE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: notices that Milo is chewing gum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo holds up a big plastic bag filled with bubble gum. Judge Allen grabs it, takes a piece of gum and hands it to the Bailiff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bailiff takes the bag, offers one to Ned... who takes a piece, unwraps it and starts chewing. The Bailiff then proceeds to pass out gum to EVERYONE in the courtroom. The JURY FOREMAN raises his hand and clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The courtroom erupts in CHEERS! Judge Allen raps the gavel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He does. The Judge leans toward him, reaching out to cover the microphone, covering the end of the gavel instead. The Judge's voice is AMPLIFIED over the courtroom speakers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned turns... looking out over the courtroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a surprised GASP from the crowd... and a loud MURMUR. The BAILIFF holds out a video box. It's titled HOLY BIBLE - THE VIDEO. Ned puts one hand on it, raises the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned sits down... then gets up, his demeanor changing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slips back into the witness box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned steps over to Arch, who is sitting in the first row of the gallery. Arch hands him the Miranda "cue cards."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lays them on the corner of the stand... then slips into the chair. He picks the cards up and flips thru them. On the back we can see scribbled... "NED'S IDIOT CARDS" NED Yeah. These are them. Ned jumps to his feet, pacing dramatically, grabbing the cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned pivots into the witness stand, changing his attitude from aggressive attorney to defensive, angry witness as he hits the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The courtroom ERUPTS! The Judge bangs the gavel. Ned strides proudly toward the defense table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned turns. The Judge motions with a finger for Ned to approach the bench. Ned does, resting his hand on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Judge smacks Ned's hand with a ruler!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Judge mistakenly picks up the microphone and whacks it on the bench like a gavel. BAM! BAM! BAM! It is DEAFENING! Everyone covers their ears in pain. The THX Sound System Logo appears at the bottom of the screen... along with "The Courtroom Is Listening"
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Crumley... you cannot chew gum in my courtroom... unless you have enough for everyone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bailiff. Pass these out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And don't forget the jury.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And so, desperate and broke, with no other options before him, Mr. Crumley went to eleven Savings & Loans and did what any of you would have done. He stole back the money that the S&Ls had stolen from him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Mr. Ravine... please approach the bench.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not running for congress here, so knock off the speeches and quit inciting these brainless morons! Now pick up the pace and wrap this son- of-a-bitch up! Call your first witness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I call... Detective Ned Ravine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you swear to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help you God?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Detective Ravine, at the time of the arrest, did you read the defendant his Miranda rights?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course. That's standard procedure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are these the cards Officer Brooks used to prompt you while reading Mr. Crumley his rights?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Reading from the cards now... quote "You have the right to remain silent, if you waive that right, anything you say... may be used against you in a court of law." Is that right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (back in the chair) That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stands up, announces)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! The official Miranda warning is... "anything you say CAN be used against you in a court of law." Not "may"... "CAN!" (on the attack) Don't you know the difference between "can" and "may", Detective? Every school kid knows "can" is a verb that indicates ability to perform, while "may" is a verbal auxiliary indicating the permission to act.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't have time to worry about past participles or interrogative pronouns! I was trying to protect society from a deranged MADMAN! (leaps up, pointing) But this ivy league fop...!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have no more use for this witness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Ravine...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm dismissing this case on the grounds of improper grammar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ow!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumps up) But your Honor...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know, I know. It's a technicality. But it's the kind of technicality that makes the American legal system what it is today! Court's adjourned!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned turns the key... enters through the private door. He HEARS the plaintive sound of a saxophone playing Lola's Theme... his eyes drawn to the slightly opened door to the outer office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gorgeous pair of legs, sleek nylons, high-heeled shoes. There are several CANDY WRAPPERS, CIGARETTE BUTTS and other pieces of TRASH stuck to the bottom of one shoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pushes the door open. It's Lola. She wears a tight white dress, long white gloves and broad-brimmed hat. The hat tips up slowly, revealing her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned reaches in his pocket, pulls out a wet paper towel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola proudly holds up a tiny bobbie pin. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned looks at the door. The frame and lock have been brutally chewed away, as if someone used a jackhammer on them! She pulls out a pack of cigarettes... BLACK LUNG LITES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes to the water cooler. She lights up, exhaling a soft cloud of smoke through a sleepy smile, her voice purring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned hesitates... about to drink from the paper cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gulps the water down, crumbles the cup in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned turns, tries to casually "dunk" the crumpled cup in the waste basket. He misses. Laura enters with a huge pile of lawbooks in her arms. She sees Ned miss the basket and darts over as he bends down to pick it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She picks it up and tosses it into the waste basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura sets the heavy load of books on the desk and steps toward Lola, extending her hand. Lola takes her time removing the long white glove... finally reaching out and shaking Laura's hand with a condescending air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned grabs the books and turns to the bookshelf, replacing each lawbook in its proper slot. The "handshake" between Lola and Laura turns tense, then aggressive, eventually becoming a "standing Indian wrestle" as they try to force each other off balance with sheer force. Ned is oblivious to the battle behind him, chattering away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura suddenly whirls Lola around, putting her in an arm lock. But Lola elbows Laura in the stomach! Laura doubles over. Lola feigns sympathy, taking her hand... then spins, twisting Laura's arm, flipping her head over heels! Laura lands on the couch... upside down... gasping. Lola strikes a haughty pose, still holding her lit cigarette. She takes a drag. Laura checks her watch, then tumbles off the couch, landing on her feet. She straightens her skirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finished with the books, Ned turns... smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola looks at Laura... icy, haughty, triumphant. Laura moves reluctantly toward the door, sees the lock and door frame chewed to pieces... whirls around, heads back toward Ned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She instantly spins around, heads back toward the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and exits. Ned sits down on the corner of the desk. Lola sits in the chair across from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She crosses her legs suggestively... then slowly, enticingly, re-crosses them in the other direction. Unimpressed, Ned opens Laura's desk drawer... pulls a pair of sexy lace panties from a Kleenex-style dispenser box labeled "PANDORA'S POP-UP PANTIES"... which pulls another pair up into position. He tosses the panties to Lola.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She does... very, very slowly and seductively... as they talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She finishes pulling the panties on with a sultry smile... "snapping" the elastic waistband. She goes to the door, pauses... turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks around, exhaling another cloud of smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She opens the door. Behind her, in the hall, we see Dizzy, the saxophone player, wailing away on "Lola's Theme."
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I waited. You never came back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got busy. Here's that paper towel I promised.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How'd you get in? The door was locked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's miraculous what a real woman can do... with a bobbie pin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (offering) Cigarette?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... thanks. They're bad for ya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I know. I like things that are bad for me. (touching lawbooks) So... I hear you go both ways.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only once. It was a fraternity prank. I never saw him again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I mean... you're a cop and a lawyer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. Yeah. Well, there's a lot of scum out there on the streets... but they all deserve a fair and costly trial.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll get that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... Laura... this is, uh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lola Cain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sarcastic) So lovely to meet you, Laura.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gotta keep these darn books in their right place or we'll never find the ones we need. Let's see, Q thru M... R thru B... W thru F...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's getting late. I'll give you a ride home, Ned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have my car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll tow you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not today. You don't need to wait. I'll see you tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I should call someone to fix this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tomorrow...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll call from home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think I should warn you, Mr. Ravine... I'm not wearing any underwear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Try these on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So... what can I do for you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've run across some... papers... and I thought you might be able to tell me what they are. You see, I'm not very experienced when it comes to... papers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll help you Miss Cain, if I'm able. Do you have the... papers... here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... they're at home. I thought you might stop by...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm on duty tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't they ever give you a night off?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (picks up cigarette) Why don't we meet tomorrow evening then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll let you know where.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (steps over to her) What's wrong with my office?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing a good interior decorator couldn't fix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She takes a final, long drag on her cigarette, then reaches O.S. with it... toward Ned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a sultry smile, she turns and leaves, closing the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Take care of this for me, will ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cigarette is stuck in his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The front door swings open. Frank is standing there, dressed in a cheap, loose-fitting suit and a T-shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lana, now wearing the diaphanous gown, pulls him inside. She kisses him hungrily, slipping a frilly plastic shower cap with a gaudy floral design on his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks to the living room. Frank follows, still wearing the shower cap. Lana snaps her fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sits in a chair, looking around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sits on the couch, picks up a stack of papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up at Frank. Sees the shower cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slips the shower cap off as Lana continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He flips through, scanning the pages, shrugging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She drops to her knees in front of him, her face close to his, speaking with a persuasive urgency.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gets up, walks to the adjoining room... snapping her fingers at her side. He follows. She steps to a table, pulls the cover off an elaborate scale- model of Dealey Plaza and a train station, complete with HO- Scale model trains chugging around the tracks. She uses a pointer to trace the route to the depot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ignoring this, she turns the LIGHTS OFF, walks over to a screen and picks up a remote control. She clicks the button. A SLIDE PROJECTOR comes on, throwing an IMAGE on Frank's back. We can read the words: THE PLAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves over. "THE PLAN" appears on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she talks, IMAGES appear on the screen, accompanying her rapid spiel. We see: a shot of the depot, a map of the rail route, a gun, a river, a Bingo game, baseball action and a huge dollar sign!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights click ON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They embrace, kissing passionately, dropping out of frame. The model train CHUGS faster, the train whistle SHRIEKING a long "Woooooooo-woooooooooo!"... racing into a model tunnel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I came back for my shower cap.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well you came to the right place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On duty all night. By the time he wraps up his reports, it'll be close to noon tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was just reading over...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take off the hat, Frank.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was just reading over my husband's insurance policies. You wouldn't know anything about insurance, would you, Frankie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, matter of fact, I sell policies part-time. I got half a brain... or didn't you notice?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I musta had my eye on something else. (hands him papers) How about a translation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Standard accident policy... all the usual stuff... blah, blah, blah. The face value is... Wow. Not bad. Three million bucks! (flips page) And there's a triple indemnity rider.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Meaning?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, it's just something agents throw in so we can boost the premium. If the policy holder dies under very specific conditions, it pays off three times the face value of the policy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nine million dollars...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah... but it's a sure bet for the company. Nobody ever collects.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, like here... it only pays off if he's shot with a pistol, falls from a moving northbound train and drowns in a fresh water stream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All three?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See what I mean, sweetheart? What are the odds of that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It could happen. (dramatic beat) Suppose it did happen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then you'd be rich.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we'd be rich.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're you sayin'...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're gonna kill the son-of-a-bitch! And I know exactly how! He has a legal symposium in Santa Barbara this weekend... All we have to do is get him to take the train up instead of driving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How we gonna do that? Didn't you tell me he hates trains?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's where you come in, baby. You're gonna rig his car so it doesn't work. That should be no problem for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then... we give him a lift to the train station... through Dealey Plaza, past the Book Suppository and around the grassy knoll...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't that out of our way?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Move, Frank.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And pay attention.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ten minutes out of the station he'll be standing in the vestibule between cars... trying to avoid a panic attack. Fourteen minutes and ten seconds out, the train crosses the Santa Ynez River. So at thirteen minutes and fifty-four seconds, I shoot him, shove him out the door... he hits the river and drowns. Bingo! A triple play. We're rich!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You been thinking about this a lot, haven't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. It just came to me. (closer, seductive) I had this image of a big, powerful, throbbing train... plunging into a long, dark, wet tunnel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned and Arch drag in a bunch of bad-ass, multi-ethnic GANG MEMBERS they've just busted. Ned angrily shoves one of the toughest gang members against the wall... losing his cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned goes ballistic and slams him into the wall again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arch grabs Ned by the shoulder, pulling him back, calming him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned regains his composure. He's depressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gang Member #1 steps closer, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gang Member #1 steps closer, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He steps between them, putting his arm around Ned's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He steps back, begins to SING "Try A Little Tenderness"...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other Gang Members join in on the SECOND VERSE with a sweet, mellow street-corner harmony as back-up... and some smooth group choreography. The COPS on duty listen raptly, getting maudlin and dewey- eyed. Tears roll down the cheeks of the BOOKING SERGEANT. The lights dim. A big, gruff COP makes eyes at a HOOKER being booked... and they start to slow dance. Arch watches all this with a sentimental smile, munching on his Nachos. When the song ends, Arch puts a comforting hand, covered with Nacho cheese, on Ned's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned nods, smiles and gratefully "high-fives" the Gang Members as he heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stand over there and shut up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 Hey, man, we got rights! Don't you be layin' no deleterious malfeasance on us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch your mouth, punk! I don't want to hear language like that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa, hold on, hoss! Take it easy. You seem a little tense tonight. What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw... I don't know. I guess it's Lana. It's just... I know she wants to have a baby so bad...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...but I never get to spend any time with her. And when I am home... it's like she's, you know... avoiding sex.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 You should try to be more sensitive, man. More romantic. Bring her flowers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 Try to understand how she feels. After all...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 She may be weary... Women do get weary... Wearing that same old shabby dress... But when she's weary... Try a little ten-der-ness...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That can't be it. I'm the tenderest guy on the force. Nah... I think she's just afraid she won't be able to get pregnant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's to be afraid! It's like making breakfast! You bring home the bacon... she's got the eggs. Ya scramble it up. Ba-da-boom ba-da-bing! She's got an omelette in the oven! (a beat, then) Why don't you knock off early... go home. It'd be nice for Lana to wake up in the morning and find you there for a change.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Naw... I can't. I got all this paperwork.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 We'll do our own paperwork, man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah! We'll fill out all that shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The house is dark. A key turns in the lock and Ned enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's dark. Ned quietly undresses and slips into bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sunlight creeps through the windows. Lana's eyes flutter open. She sees Ned beside her... sleeping. Suddenly, it hits her. She turns! Frank is on the other side, curled up, snoring. She's laying between both men! Lana elbows Frank. He stirs, groggy. She covers his mouth... indicating Ned. Frank's eyes bug out! He slips out of bed. The bed frame SQUEAKS LOUDLY! Frank freezes. Ned sleeps on steadily. Frank grabs his clothes. An unending torrent of coins fall out of his pants pockets, CLANGING on the floor! He freezes. Ned sleeps on. Frank retrieves the coins, clumsily stepping on the TV REMOTE CONTROL. A high-tech, sleekly designed TELEVISION MONITOR rises up... clicks ON. Frank tries frantically to push the set down, but it keeps rising into position. An IMAGE appears. It's WILLARD SCOTT, doing the weather on the TODAY SHOW. Frank grabs the remote control, frantically pounding on all the buttons. The VOLUME goes up... SOUND BLASTING!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The alarm clock goes off, CLANGING LOUDLY! Lana dives for it, slamming her hand down, killing the alarm. Going for a double-play, she flings the clock at the TV, nailing the on/off switch! Silence. Ned is still out cold. Frank moves toward the door... but with each step the floor CREAKS LOUDLY! He turns the knob. It CLUNKS! He pulls the door open v-e-r-y s-l-o-w-l-y and it CRE-E-E-E-A-K-S like the piercing metal brakes of a train! He blows Lana a kiss, then pulls the door closed very gently. It sticks. He pulls harder. The knob pops off in his hand and he falls backward, tumbling down the stairs with a HUGE RACKET! Ned doesn't stir. Finally it's SILENT. Lana exhales.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (on television) ...and Mrs. Prudy Ann Camomile of Delphi, Georgia is one-hundred and thirteen! What a gorgeous hunk of female! Smokes three cigars a day, drinks a straight shot of vodka at bedtime... and still has sex!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: lands on the sill of the open window, trilling a sweet little "CHIRP." Ned sits bolt upright, irritated.

direction.raw_text: He grabs his shoe, heaving it toward the open window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Damn birds!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Frank glances back up at the bedroom window with an arrogant smirk. WHAP! Ned's shoe hits him right in the face!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned comes down the courthouse steps. He pauses in the street, glimpsing the back of a WOMAN passing nearby... a STUNNING BLOND decked out in a clinging dress and fashionable hat... a long strip of toilet paper trailing from her high heel shoe. It must be LOLA. He turns to watch her.

direction.raw_text: . SHADY, an older woman with a pleasant appearance, sits in an overstuffed leather chair. Ned and Laura enter.

direction.raw_text: She struggles to her feet feebly...

direction.raw_text: She grabs the tail of his suit jacket and rips it up the back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and shuffles out, passing through the outer office.

direction.raw_text: She grabs a handful of cookies and casually flings them at Laura... as she heads out the door.

direction.raw_text: Laura rushes into Ned's office with the file folder. He staggers unsteadily by the desk.

direction.raw_text: Laura looks puzzled... wondering where it might be. Then...

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Mrs. Shady.

dialogue.raw_text: Laura... check on my insurance. Make sure it's paid up.

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Good idea, Mr. Ravine. My son, Max, is getting out of prison tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (checks his watch) Gee, has it been seven years already?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Seven long, miserable years in the slammer. And he's a bit pissed off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, being locked in a tiny room with no TV can make a guy feel pretty tense.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY I'm very concerned about him, Mr. Ravine. He said you were a two-bit shyster... and he's going to rip your head off and use it for a bowling ball!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure the experience wasn't all negative. He probably made a lot of friends...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY (ever hopeful) You think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...learned a useful trade...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Oh yes... live autopsies...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...caught up on all those books he wanted to read...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Maybe so... but he said he's going to punch you in the testicles...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY ...smash your face...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY ...and decimate your wardrobe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY And I wouldn't want that to happen. (spanks his butt) He's a naughty naughty boy. I just thought I should warn you.

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY (to Laura) Bye for now. (pauses by desk) Oh... may I have a cookie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (at file cabinet) Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Thank yooooooooou.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God, Ned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hate when she comes to see me.

dialogue.raw_text: (sees file) What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Extreme peril. You know, the risk of personal bodily harm.

direction.raw_text: of her abusive HUSBAND... sneering. A circle has been drawn around his head with lipstick and a diagonal line slashed across his face.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura's Husband turns from the porthole. Laura cowers. The boat pitches and heaves, disturbing all the neatly hung towels, emblazoned with MINE - MINE - MINE across the bottom edge. Laura's Husband reacts with a crazed look in his eyes. Laura makes a break for it, running up on deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura's Husband scrambles up onto the deck, looking fore and aft. Laura's vanished! He looks out to sea, calling...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lau-raaaaa!

direction.raw_text: Laura cuts an inch of hair from her amazingly long, very wet tresses, then puts on a WIG... that is also LONG and WET!

direction.raw_text: Laura retrieves a bra and a package of Twinkies from a secret hiding place... and stuffs them into a small brown paper bag.

direction.raw_text: She uses an industrial buffer to wax the hardwood floor.

direction.raw_text: It's dark, seductive, smoky, crowded... and HOT. Everybody is dripping with sweat and holding unlit cigarettes. Ned enters, sees Lola sitting on a stool at the bar, one leg crossed provocatively over the other. A beer can is stuck to the gum on the bottom of her shoe. It falls off with a CLUNK. He sits on the stool next to her. She looks at him, smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches into his jacket pocket, pulls out a LIT CIGARETTE. It has a very long ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes it... inhales a drag, then lets the smoke flow out through her smile. It flows out for a loooooooooong time! More smoke than she could ever have inhaled. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He notices the drink in her hand is BOILING. A saxophone begins to softly wail Lola's Theme. Ned looks over to see a QUARTET, featuring Dizzy on sax. The GUITARIST spontaneously bursts into FLAME! A FIREMAN, in full gear, jumps up from the bar and puts out the blaze with a fire extinguisher. None of the band members miss a beat.

direction.raw_text: Ned glances at the MALE CUSTOMERS... sitting at the bar across from them. They're staring coldly at Ned.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah, before I forget... you asked me to take care of this.

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks...

dialogue.raw_text: You smoke too much. (looks around, then) It's hot tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it? I never know. My body heat runs about twenty degrees above normal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we should look for a cooler place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I doubt we'll find one. Even the wind chimes on my porch aren't moving much these days. They keep thudding softly, like dairy cows bumping butts in the night. I go out there expecting to find a cool breeze... but it's just a lot of hot air.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're they lookin' at?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A lot of them have tried that seat. You're the first one's lasted this long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel honored.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't. It's broken.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you bring the... papers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I thought you might come over...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. I'll drive you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I brought my own car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll follow you then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know it sounds silly, but would you leave first... wait in your car? I come here a lot and I wouldn't want those men to think I'm "easy"... a slut who'll jump into bed with anyone at the drop of a hat. But if you leave first...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...they'll think I'm a putz for passing up a sure thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (for all to hear) Now leave me alone!

direction.raw_text: Ned is a mess! Blood trickles from the side of his mouth. Shirt soaked in sweat. He turns the radio ON. LOLA'S THEME starts playing. A small ceiling fan hangs from the interior roof of his car, turning slowly. The venetian blinds on his side windows are partially open, letting in slashes of dramatic light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's following Lola's car. It signals and turns left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still hot, Ned pulls the chain on the ceiling fan. It spins faster. MUCH faster! The car becomes like a wind tunnel!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two cars enter a long drive, coming to a stop near a large two story house surrounded by lush greenery. Ned climbs out... his wind-blown hair flattened on one side and sticking out crazily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NED'S POV It opens. Lola's legs swing out. The CAMERA PANS DOWN her long legs to her feet. The car floormat is stuck to one shoe. She casually shakes it off... going to the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They enter. It's DARK. Ned squints into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola CLAPS her hands twice and all the LIGHTS COME ON. She smiles at him... drops her car keys on the hall table, then goes up the stairs. Ned drops his car keys on the table too and follows her.

dialogue.raw_text: Well, here we are... in the dark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have The Clapper.

dialogue.raw_text: You what?

direction.raw_text: Lola clicks on a porch light. She and Ned step out. Dozens of small boxes hang around the perimeter of the porch.

direction.raw_text: Ned steps over, running his hands along the boxes. They "thud" against each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slips several boxes off, releasing clusters of the metal chimes. They "tinkle" and "clang" melodically in the breeze.

direction.raw_text: She moves close, coming on to him. Ned feels uneasy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My wind chimes.

direction.raw_text: Ned is looking through a book... "KAMIKAZE KAMA SUTRA - The Encyclopedia of Deadly Sexual Positions." Lola comes back in, hands Ned the two scraps of paper.

dialogue.raw_text: No. You keep them... as a memento of our time together.

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't there some other way?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I suppose you could wash my car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I mean, isn't there something else you want? Something I could give you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey... slow down... there's a speed limit in this state. Sixty-five miles an hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How fast was I going, officer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, about a hundred and twenty-three.

dialogue.raw_text: Suppose you pull me over and frisk me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Suppose I let you off with a warning?

dialogue.raw_text: Suppose I find a cop with a bigger nightstick?

dialogue.raw_text: Suppose I put you under arrest for being a bad girl with bad thoughts?

dialogue.raw_text: Suppose you handcuff me to the bed?

(shakes his head) Nah... I better be going.

direction.raw_text: Ned opens the door, pauses, turns... as Lola joins him there. She looks into his eyes with desire.

direction.raw_text: She moves her lips close to his, about to kiss him. Then...

direction.raw_text: He steps out, pauses... turns to her.

direction.raw_text: Ned pulls the door shut. The lock CLICKS. He pauses by his car, realizing something, heaves a sigh, goes back to the door. He tries the knob, but the door is locked. He looks through the small window. He sees Lola standing inside... breathing heavily, bracing herself against the staircase bannister, hand to her heaving chest as if to calm a pounding heart. He pushes against the door. It won't budge. He goes to the large window, gazing inside. She slides one hand enticingly across her breast and thigh, striking a seductive pose. He points toward the door, motioning for her to unlock it. She looks away. Frustrated, Ned tries the window. It's locked. He picks up a wrought iron chair, SLAMS it into the window! The heavy chair falls apart. The glass doesn't even vibrate! He sees a riding power mower in the driveway... jumps into the seat, starts the engine... barreling toward the front of the house! THUNDER CRASHES and LIGHTNING FLASHES in the sky! He PLOWS into the side of the house, SMASHING a huge hole thru the wall!... MOWING a swath in the carpet! Lola GASPS. Ned climbs off the mower, moving toward her. She opens her arms, breathless. The MUSIC SWELLS dramatically! She intercepts him, embracing him passionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He struggles free, grabbing his car keys from the hall table. She follows, embracing him again, even more tenaciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Impatient, she crushes her mouth against his, kissing him hard, desperately clawing at his clothes. She's relentless... devouring him with her lips and tongue. Overwhelmed, he succumbs to her passion. His car keys drop from his hand. She pushes him down toward the floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're not so tough. Last chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No thanks. I got a cold shower and a wife who trusts me waiting at home.

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter? Don't you want me? It's the way I look, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't forget to lock up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew you'd come back...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking past her) I forgot my car keys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not what you came back for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes it is.

direction.raw_text: Her hands grasp his shirt, ripping it open. The buttons fly in all directions! She grabs at his leather belt, twisting it in her hands... ripping it in two! She grabs his pants by the cuffs... rips one pant leg off! Then the other!... tossing them over each shoulder! Ned and Lola tumble across the floor, arms and legs entangled... rolling themselves up in a rug in the process.

direction.raw_text: A roaring fire. We HEAR O.C. MOANING and HEAVY BREATHING. The CAMERA TILTS DOWN to a sheepskin rug in front of the fireplace. No one is there! A crystal vase falls, CRASHING on the stone hearth. The CAMERA TILTS UP to REVEAL Ned and Lola... stretched out on the mantle, ravishing each other.

direction.raw_text: The door suddenly BURSTS OPEN! Ned and Lola tumble out... wrapped in each other's arms, food tumbling out with them.

She lays on the table, arms and legs stretched upward... a spinning plate balanced on the pointed finger of each hand... and a large spinning platter balanced on the end of her pointed left toe. Her right foot brushes the platter to keep it spinning. The Ed Sullivan Show position.

direction.raw_text: Ned sitting, wrists tied to the brass bed with silk scarves.

direction.raw_text: Lola, also with her wrists tied to the bed with silk scarves.

direction.raw_text: Wrapped in each other's arms, they tumble down the stairs... crashing into a workbench, still kissing passionately!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned's hand plugs in a cord. RACK FOCUS to a soft lamb's wool BUFFER WHEEL rising into frame, WHIRRING. It dips into an open can of FLOOR WAX... then moves over to Lola's naked body, buffing the surface of her skin to a high gloss. The CAMERA MOVES to her EYES. They're CROSSED in ecstasy.

direction.raw_text: . SQUEAKY BED NOISES. The CAMERA MOVES up along the mattress. The bed moves with a jerky rhythm. The CAMERA REVEALS Lola's hand, grasping the sheet tightly. WE MOVE UP to Lola, lying face down against the pillow.

dialogue.raw_text: (breathless) ...don't... stop...

dialogue.raw_text: ...Oh Ned... please... don't... stop...

direction.raw_text: The wind blows. THUNDER and LIGHTNING! RAIN pours down. Ned and Lola, both in yellow rain slickers, ravish each other lustfully on the roof, sliding down the incline of shingles. Oblivious to the peril, they slip right over the edge! They hang from the eaves trough, each clutching it with one hand while still holding one another with their free arms... kissing passionately. The trough breaks! They fall!

direction.raw_text: They roll out of the bushes onto the lawn, arms and legs entangled. They fall apart, gasping for breath. A beat.

direction.raw_text: The cell wall is a clutter of PHOTOS: Hitler... Mussolini... Charles Manson... and his mother, Mrs. Shady. A man's muscular naked torso rises into frame, his back to us. He's doing pull-ups, his body covered with TATTOOS! Quotes on each arm... "Don't have a cow, man!" - Bart Simpson... and "I know you are, but what am I?" - Pee Wee Herman. On one shoulder, a gravestone with the epitaph "I told you I was sick!" In the center of his back... we see a big tattoo of Ned's face labeled "DEAD MEAT."

direction.raw_text: opens the cell door.

direction.raw_text: The prisoner turns. He's butt-ugly, hard, nasty looking. It's MAX SHADY... with a HUGE "Double Corona" CIGAR in his mouth. On his chest is a tattoo that reads: THIS SPACE FOR RENT. He walks right toward the CAMERA LENS and the FRAME goes TO BLACK.

dialogue.raw_text: It's time, Max.

direction.raw_text: A ceiling fan rotates slowly... a pair of shorts and a nylon stocking hanging from the blades. The house is a wreck! The CAMERA MOVES DOWN to Ned and Lola, both reclining in a big claw-foot bathtub, facing each other, their arms draped lazily over the sides. Ned's eyes are closed. "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" plays on the stereo in the b.g. Lola's hand reaches for an ICE PICK on the floor, raising it up slowly. Then... CLICK!... ignites the cigarette lighter in the handle, touching the flame to the end of her cigarette. Lola smiles at him, then lets the chunk of ice slide into the water... and pushes it between Ned's legs. He cringes, eyes crossed. direction.raw_text: Ned pulls his feet in, sits up... suddenly feeling vulnerable. He measures his words very, very carefully.

direction.raw_text: His voice begins to ECHO and FADE as the CAMERA MOVES IN to a CU of Lola's enraged EYES!

direction.raw_text: And then WE SEE...

dialogue.raw_text: That's Madam Butterfly, isn't it?

dialogue.raw_text: (listening) Oh yeah, sure... now I can hear it.

dialogue.raw_text: It tells the sad story of a woman who is rejected by her lover after a brief, but torrid, affair... so she stalks him with an ice pick and stabs him with it more than a thousand times.

dialogue.raw_text: Really? I never could understand the lyrics.

dialogue.raw_text: You know, what happened last night was very, uh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... it was. I should check on my homeowners insurance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But we can't ever let it happen again. Ever!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you saying, Ned? That you're rejecting me, your lover, after a brief, but torrid, affair?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wouldn't put it exactly like that. It's just that... well, I'm married to a wonderful woman... who is very, very attractive... (but adds quickly) ...not that you aren't very attractive!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice echoing) ...you aren't very attractive... you aren't very attractive... you aren't very attractive...

direction.raw_text: of her hand, grasping the ice pick... scratching it along the side of the tub, peeling back the porcelain. A GRATING SCREECH OVERLAPS to...

direction.raw_text: on a SCREECHING TROPICAL BIRD. We PULL BACK to reveal Ned looking around the store. His ripped pants have been temporarily repaired with big pieces of masking tape. A CLERK steps over with two big Parrots on her shoulders.

direction.raw_text: She eyes him suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turns and SHOUTS at the noisy birds.

direction.raw_text: They do. She turns back to Ned.

dialogue.raw_text: Don't touch anything. You bond with it... you buy it. Whatdya want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to buy a pet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. For what purpose?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a gift... for my wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. They all say that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She spends a lot of time alone. I thought it might be nice if she had something to keep her company.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Sure. I bet. How do I know you're not the kind of guy who punches out parakeets? Or takes some poor defenseless animal, throws it in a sack and runs over it with your car five or six times.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would never hurt an animal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, I would. They're driving me CRAZY!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shuddup!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay... tell me more about this broad you're married to. I like to match people with the pets they deserve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A typical police squad room... smoke-filled, cluttered, busy. Arch sits at a desk doing paperwork, surrounded by the Gang Members... who are also filling out papers. Arch SINGS to himself, munching on nachos from a big pile of chips. The Gang Members harmonize with him. A Gang Member reaches for a nacho chip. Arch grabs for the gun in his shoulder holster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Gang Member drops the chip. Arch pops it in his mouth, continues singing. The Gang Members join in with harmony. Ned enters in the background, carrying a box with airholes in it. He steps over to his desk, looking at the singing Gang Members, then motions like a choir leader, cutting them off neatly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all hand over their completed paperwork. Ned stares at them for a beat... surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They do. He opens the files... checks out the papers. Arch notices something O.S. and gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arch turns the sound up on a wall-mounted TV monitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the screen... it's Max Shady speaking to the press.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arch slumps in his chair, really stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned laughs it off. He starts checking through the messages and paperwork on his desk. The PHONE RINGS. He picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned's face darkens. He turns away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Uh-uh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (doubtful) You do all my paperwork?

dialogue.raw_text: Get out of here.

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Ned! Catch this! Friend of yours.

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (on T.V.) ...I'd like to reach down Ned Ravine's throat and pull out his guts with my bare hands!

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked) Jesus... you hear that?

dialogue.raw_text: He's just working through his anger, trying to find a constructive outlet.

dialogue.raw_text: Are you kiddin'! He'll do it! The guy's a friggin' looney!

dialogue.raw_text: Trust me, I spent a lot of time with him when I was preparing his case. He's really a very sweet, sensitive human being.

dialogue.raw_text: He gets a little melon-dramatic.

dialogue.raw_text: (on T.V.) ...then cut off all his fingers and rip out his liver with my teeth!

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs) See. Loves to exaggerate.

dialogue.raw_text: Christ, Ned... you're in deep shit.

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant Ravine.

direction.raw_text: Speaking into the phone... intense, obsessive.

dialogue.raw_text: I want to see you, Ned.

direction.raw_text: (whispering harshly) I told you not to call me! It's finished between us. No. No, I'm not sucking anything of yours anymore! (voice gets louder) It's done! OVER! He SLAMS the receiver down, shattering the phone! Everyone stares at Ned in stunned silence.

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs it off) Wrong number.

direction.raw_text: She's in the bathtub, phone receiver in one hand, still jabbing at the porcelain tub with the ice pick. Water squirts from the holes she's punctured in the side of the tub. She flings the ice pick at the wall. It sticks!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lana is seated on a park bench wearing a trenchcoat, hat and sunglasses. Frank walks up, looks around nervously, pretending not to know Lana. He sits down next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hands him a hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes her sunglasses off, looks at him. He hesitates, staring at the hat. A dignified looking OLDER GENTLEMAN approaches. Frank quickly slips the hat on his head. The Older Gentleman sits on the bench across from them. He opens a paper sack and begins neatly laying his lunch out next to him. An apple, sandwich, napkin, Mountain Dew.

direction.raw_text: We see the SUB-TITLE "Speak Yiddish." From this point on, all their dialog is in YIDDISH... but it appears in ENGLISH SUB-TITLES across the bottom of the screen.

dialogue.raw_text: How come we gotta meet here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have to be careful now. We can't risk being seen together at the house or someone might connect us to the murder later on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here... put this on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers to Frank) Speak Yiddish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Red Yiddish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ich hobe getracht, efsher iz der nisht geshtoigen un nisht gefloygen. (I been thinkin'... maybe this plan is too complicated.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zein nisht azoy meshige! Der plan iz kosher vi yosher. (Quit worrying. The plan is perfect.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He tosses crumbs of his sandwich to the pigeons, occasionally glancing up at Frank and Lana. Whenever they speak, however, his eyes look down toward their legs.

direction.raw_text: with SUB-TITLES across the bottom of screen, about knee-level.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks around nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both look at him... stunned. A long beat.

direction.raw_text: Frank and Lana are speechless. But across the bottom of the screen we see a SUB-TITLE reflecting their thoughts.

dialogue.raw_text: Yo! Ober mir darfen imvarfen in tsug. Un schissen un schtippen in vasser arein. Oy a broch! Mir zenen git bakackt. (Yeah, but we gotta get him on the train, shoot him... then push him in the river. There's a million ways we can screw up.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vus iz mit idr? Die host a vaichen schmoke? (You're not going soft on me, are you?)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ven hob ich gehat a vaichen schmoke? (When have I ever gone soft on you?)

dialogue.raw_text: Lest'n Yomkippur. (Last Yom Kippur.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nu shoin, ein mul. Es paseert tsie yeyden man. (Okay... once! It happens to every guy.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oy! Mir vellen zein oif groise tsures. Me'vet unz chap'n. (We're going to be in big trouble. They're going to catch us.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's very little risk involved. Statistics reveal that less than thirty-two percent of all murderers are ever apprehended.

dialogue.raw_text: You speak Yiddish?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. But I can read sub-titles.

dialogue.raw_text: Oy vay!

direction.raw_text: Ned enters, carrying the box. He sets it down on her desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes into his office, starts to change out of his tattered suit. Laura talks to him from the outer office.

direction.raw_text: She steps into the doorway of his office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She returns to her desk. Disturbed, Ned quickly pulls the shirt collar out, checks it.

direction.raw_text: She opens the blinds behind her and looks at Ned through the window between their offices.

direction.raw_text: She picks up a stack of papers from the FAX machine. Ned steps into the doorway, wearing a clean shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She opens her purse, pulls out a big COLT .45, holding it out to him. Ned stares at it, taken aback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands the gun back to her... goes to the door... opens it. There's a young DELIVERY MAN holding a bouquet of flowers.

direction.raw_text: Ned grabs the flowers, slams the door. Laura takes the envelope from the flowers... opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at the card... her expression turning cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She grabs the flowers... takes them into the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned opens the envelope. An audio cassette drops into his hand. Written on the label: PLAY ME. From the bathroom, we hear the LOUD SOUND of a TOILET FLUSHING.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh gee, you shouldn't have...

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't. It's for my wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She called. Wondered why you never came home last night. I told her you were working with a client, undercover.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Were you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's lipstick on your collar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No there isn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... there isn't. But you answered my question. She's a real looker, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lola Cain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hadn't noticed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I noticed how you hadn't noticed. (returns to work) That's alright. She noticed enough for both of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I worry about you, Ned. I worry a lot. (hands him papers) Max Shady's been faxing death threats to you all morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading bits) ...stick a knife in your... (reacts, next) ...rip the eyeballs out of your... (next) ...drive razor-sharp spikes under your...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you get to the one...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...cut it off... shove it in a blender.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah... that one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (tosses them aside) He's just getting it out of his system. Once they say it... they never do it. You know... like the President.

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers) Wait. It might be him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where did you get that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as if obvious) From my purse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing with it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (still obvious) Handing it to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You shoot it. A bullet comes out. Gosh, Ned, after all your years as a cop, I'd think you'd know these things.

dialogue.raw_text: Laura... put the gun away.

dialogue.raw_text: (checks card) Flowers for Ned Rav... (looks up) Hey... aren't you that lawyer guy? Man, you are dead meat!

dialogue.raw_text: Is this another sick joke from Max Shady?

dialogue.raw_text: What is it...?

dialogue.raw_text: (hands it to him) Lola Cain.

direction.raw_text: Ned guns it!... accelerating through a yellow light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see HEADLIGHTS behind Ned's car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ned, darling... I know this seems like a strange way to talk with you... but since you won't take my calls, I have no other choice. (then suddenly) Watch it! That red car's turning left!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you, Ned. We're meant to be together... forever. (then suddenly) The light's changing! Floor it! Go! Go! Go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nice move! (then sincere again) Nothing can keep us apart, Ned. Not even your wife. I'd hate to have to tell her about us, but if necessary... I will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She is following him, her eyes intense, obsessed. Dizzy sits in the back seat, noodling softly on his saxophone.

direction.raw_text: In the b.g., through the window, WE SEE Frank drop from the second floor, right onto the seat of a waiting motorcycle. He ZOOMS OFF into the night. Ned steps up behind Lana, slips his arms around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rolls her eyes at this... changes the subject.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands it to her. She opens it, looks in. She looks up, struggling unsuccessfully to hide a look of displeasure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned pulls out a PET SKUNK and puts it in Lana's lap. She forces a weak smile.

dialogue.raw_text: What happened to you last night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (guilty as charged) Why? What have you heard?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sarcastic) You could have called. But then, I suppose you were tied up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reflecting back) Only part of the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never know when you're coming home, Ned. How can I ever make any plans?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promise I'll spend more time with you. I know it's been rough, being alone so much. But I'll make it up to you. Maybe we should try again, you know... to have a baby.

dialogue.raw_text: So what's in the box?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... I brought you a present!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's... sorta like a cat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not enough like a cat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a little skunk. I got it at Birds-and-Skunks-R-Us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lola stands in the pouring rain outside, drenched... staring at Lana and Ned through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... what're you going to name him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts his arms around them both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The phone RINGS. Lana stands up, unceremoniously dropping the Skunk into Ned's arms. She goes into...
