dialogue.raw_text: How about... Ned?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thinks about it) Yeah. Got a nice ring to it. I've always liked the name Ned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No kidding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So whatdya think? You love Ned Junior as much as you love me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At least.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ...to answer the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello?... Hello?... Hello? (then, whispering) Frank? Is that you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lola is in a glass telephone booth with venetian blinds and a ceiling fan. She cracks the blinds open. In the background, through a window, we can see Lana in the house on the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (filtered) I told you not to call. Frank? FRANK!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned enters the cavernous marble rotunda, turns down a hallway crowded with milling attorneys and defendants. Lola suddenly intercepts him... a newspaper trailing from her high heel shoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts to move off, but she stops him, impassioned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola's voice ECHOES. BYSTANDERS gather, listening. Ned looks around self-consciously, embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CROWD presses closer... not missing a thing. A WOMAN snaps a FLASH PICTURE! A MAN turns on his video camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mortified, Ned spins on his heels and makes a bee-line for the safety of the Men's Room. Lola holds up two tickets.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who's Frank?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Frank? The only Frank I know is an auto mechanic... but I sure as hell wouldn't recommend the guy. He's really slow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had to see you, Ned. I need to feel your arms around me! I wanna suck your toes til the nails pop off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you, what happened was a big mistake. A one night stand. It's over. I have a wife...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It doesn't matter. She'll know all about us soon anyway. I want YOU! In my bed... in my arms... in MEEEEEEE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got us tickets to see Iron Butterfly!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hate opera!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned bursts in, goes to the urinal... not noticing BEN ARUGULA, an older gentleman in a business suit, standing at the urinal next to him. A beat later... Lola enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arugula glances sideways at Ned, curious and uneasy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why are you running from me? Didn't it mean ANYTHING to you?... buffing my buns with carnuba wax? (looks down) Come on, Neddy-poo. Doesn't Mr. Pokey want to go exploring?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's busy right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I told you... Mr. Pokey made a big mistake! One lousy mistake in his whole stinkin' life! So why don't you give him a BREAK! Besides... he belongs to my wife!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lana FIRES her gun rapidly... BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG!... over her shoulder, behind her back, under her leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A full-body cut-out of a man, wearing one of Ned's trademark gray suits. A HUGE SMOKING HOLE has been blown right through the crotch! Lana smirks, inhales the SMOKE from the gun barrel... and blows it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN from an official government seal that reads "ARS GRATIA ARTIS." JUDGE Ben Arugula... the distinguished looking gentleman from the men's room, sits on the bench. Ned, Laura and a SLIMY DEFENDANT stand at the defense table.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to congratulate Mr. Pokey for setting yet another unusual legal precedent. This is the first time I've ever tried a case in which the JURY was found to be insane.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The BAILIFF is handing out straitjackets to all the JURORS. The Jury Foreman struggles to get his on and laced up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to another Juror) What're you? A thirty-eight long?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The jury will be remanded to the Center For Unclear Thinking in Simi Valley. Court's adjourned.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BACK TO JUDGE ARUGULA JUDGE ARUGULA

direction.raw_text: The JURY is led from the courtroom in straitjackets and chains. Ned and Laura follow them out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the b.g. the Slimy Defendant pulls a gun and forces CITIZENS... including Judge Arugula... up against the wall, robbing them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they walk off, we HOLD ON a CLOSE SHOT of a newspaper. The headline reads: EX-CON STALKS COP/LAWYER NED RAVINE! Below it is a picture of Max Shady, eyes wide with psychotic rage... a huge cigar in his mouth, wearing a garish Hawaiian shirt. Hands lower the newspaper... revealing Max himself, with the same cigar, shirt and crazed look on his face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your BIRTHDAY! Today? Why didn't you tell me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not important. I just had one last year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'm taking you out to celebrate!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no no! It's no big thing. I'll have another one sometime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I insist. And I want to get you a nice present.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're so sweet. You don't have to. You gave me a present last year. Those lovely Ginzu knives.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah... aren't they great! They last forever. And you can cut right through a shoe with 'em!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - MONTAGE Laura models hats... each one becoming more outrageous. She coaxes Ned into joining her. They BOTH try on WOMEN's hats... smiling and laughing... as "Brown Eyed Girl" plays. In one of the mirrors, we SEE Max Shady's reflection... as he also tries on women's hats, watching them, puffing his cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura wears a baseball cap with beer cans attached to each side with long, curved plastic straws. The cap emblem reads "BEER BIMBO." A price tag hangs from it. She is beaming. In the b.g., Hawaiian DANCERS juggle flaming torches as they dance around an ICE SCULPTURE of a Hula Dancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned motions casually toward the world "out there"... sticking his thumb into the eye of a WAITER who is bending over to pick up a spoon, setting off a chaotic CHAIN REACTION of small disasters that finally culminates with someone near the dance floor bumping into the Torch Juggler, throwing his rhythm off. Distracted, he starts catching the FLAMING ENDS of the torches! OW! OH! YI! OUCH! YIPES! He drops them all. The Waiter who bumped into him, politely picks up one of the flaming torches and hands it back to the Torch Juggler. He grabs the flaming end of the torch... and lets out a SCREAM! He lunges toward a voluptuous HULA GIRL ICE SCULPTURE, grabbing the frozen breasts. His burned hands SIZZLE! Ned and Laura don't even notice... gazing only at each other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's nice to be off the streets... away from all the pain and misery out there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) What's he thinking when he looks at me with that goofy smile...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Boy, does she look stupid in that hat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) If I told him how I really feel, he'd probably fire me. What am I saying? He probably doesn't even know I exist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned slides the vestibule door open... steps toward Lana. In a daze, she raises the gun, points it at him, pulling the trigger... CLICK... CLICK... CLICK. He takes the gun from her gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank jumps up, rushing forward. He skids to a stop... seeing Ned through the glass! Shocked, he ducks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this crazy world, there's not a whole lot a guy can count on. But when the chips are down, I can always count on you. He takes her hand gently and kisses it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... then, CLICK! He snaps a handcuff on her wrist!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You risked your life to save mine. A guy can't ask any more from a woman than that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I saw you shoot him, Lana. In cold blood. I gotta arrest you for murder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ned... you wouldn't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry. I'm a cop. I have a job to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But... you said it yourself. I saved your life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, baby. I know a good lawyer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No comment.

direction.raw_text: It's huge, dark and shadowy. More than a dozen heavily armed POLICE OFFICERS stand guard all around the perimeter. In the center is a cell constructed of iron bars, like an animal cage. Ned and Laura enter. Arch steps over.

direction.raw_text: Ned flips it over.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (seeing the cage) What's this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only cell available. They had that serial killer locked up here... you know, the one who talks his victims to death then eats them... Hannibal the Lecturer. But they let him out for a three week tour to publicize his new book.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading the cover) "To Serve Man."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a cookbook.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NED'S POV On the back is a picture of HANNIBAL THE LECTURER... wearing a baseball catcher's mask with barbed wire over the mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And look, look... he autographed it. Arch pulls the front cover of the book open, pointing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arch points toward the cage.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (reads it) To Arch... Love to have you for dinner sometime... Hannibal. (hands it back) Very nice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're waiting for ya. They didn't want to start without her attorney being present.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CANTED ANGLE There's a BIG MOTH on her mouth. The CAMERA PULLS BACK SLOWLY. A beat... she spits the moth off, irritated.

direction.raw_text: Three POLICE INVESTIGATORS sit opposite Lana at a long table. Moths flutter everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned, Laura and Arch enter the cage as the Guard exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to the Investigators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura sits at the far end of the table and opens her notebook. Lana pulls out her mirrored compact, starts to apply lipstick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods toward a warning sign: a circle around a LIPSTICK with a diagonal line thru it. She responds, cool, confident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the b.g., members of the SWAT Team desperately swat at the fluttering moths. Ned spins his chair around, plants one foot on it, leans on his knee, looking hard at Lana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned raises his hand, sits down, leans close, changing his tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned stands, paces, agitated... plants his foot on the chair again. He leans toward her... getting tough again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned jumps in, motioning with his hands for this to stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slams his briefcase shut and turns to Lana, sincere.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ! Damn moths! This place could use a good exterminator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: # 2 (to Police Guard) Let's get the SWAT Team in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't you get me out of this cage, Ned? I'm goin' buggy in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Judge said no bail. Don't worry. Just tell the truth, you'll be fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's gonna handle the interrogation?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's your collar... your bust... your call... your show... your play... your move... your wife...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, okay!... I'll handle it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry Mrs. Ravine... there's no makeup allowed in this building.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're you gonna do... arrest me for primping?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't give us a tough time. Just spill it! What were you doing on that train?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confidential) As your attorney, I must advise you... you don't have to answer that question.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, quit playing games with us! (fires questions) Who put ya up to it? Where'd you get the gun? What's your link with the CIA?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa! That's it! I will not tolerate this unwarranted badgering of my client. She'll have her day in court, gentlemen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to thank you, Mrs. Ravine, for being so cooperative with these gentlemen. (turns to Laura) Did you get all that down, Laura. Every word she said?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yep. Both of 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The CAMERA MOVES IN to a wire mesh cage at the very back of the yard. A small sign on it says: NED JUNIOR. The door is open. The cage is... empty!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola rides the roller coaster with Lana's pet Skunk. She LAUGHS maniacally as they plunge down a steep grade! The Skunk stands stiffly on her lap, his paws planted on the guard rail, eyes bulging out!... his fur standing straight up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned hesitates at the front door. It's open a crack. He moves inside cautiously. There is a strange BUBBLING SOUND coming from the kitchen. He moves toward it... apprehensive. He enters the kitchen and SEES... a huge bubbling pot on the stove, foam spilling over from under the lid! His mind reels! He charges out the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned bursts out the back door... CAMERA TRACKING with his feet as he dashes across the huge back yard... MUSIC POUNDING! He SEES the EMPTY animal cage! The door is open. A fuzzy blanket hangs halfway out. Shocked, Ned spins around... running back toward the house... CAMERA TRACKING HIS FEET, struggling to keep up. The CAMERA SLAMS into a tree!... CRACKING the LENS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned bursts in... SEES the bubbling pot!... a huge butcher knife on the counter!... and LOLA, arms outstretched to greet him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She whips the cover off the bubbling pot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lifts up pasta with a spaghetti spoon... tossing a sprig of basil into the pot from the basil-leaf crown she wears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs Lola's arm and drags her toward the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She steps outside... turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He SLAMS the door in her face... hesitates a beat, curious... then pulls the door open. Lola's still there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned SLAMS the door again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: NOOOOOOOooooooo!!!

dialogue.raw_text: ! Cappelini pomodoro!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pasta with tomato sauce. Whatsa matta? You don't like Italian?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Ned Junior? WHERE IS HE?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought he might like to get out, so I took him to the amusement park.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't just break into my house, cook my food... borrow my skunk! (opens the door) Leave me alone. Stay out of my face! Out of my neighborhood! Out of my LIFE!

dialogue.raw_text: You haven't seen the last of me, Ned.

dialogue.raw_text: I told you.

direction.raw_text: cluster around a squad of CHEERLEADERS wearing sweaters emblazoned with "FREE LANA OR BUST!" across their chests. They perform a rousing CHEER in front of a sign on the building that reads... "LE COURTHOUSE".
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (with choreography) Lana, Lana, she's the one Shot a bad guy with a gun Blew that sucker off a train Some guys are a friggin' pain YaaaaaAAAAAAAAY LANA!

direction.raw_text: speaks to a TV camera.

direction.raw_text: Ned and Laura push their way through the crush of REPORTERS.

dialogue.raw_text: Once again, Americans are making a mockery of their courts, turning a murder trial into a media circus! How can justice ever prevail when it is ridiculed and reviled in such a heinously revolting manner? This is Clement Von Franckenstein returning you to our BBC studios in London for the latest photographs of Lady Di naked in the bath.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Spectators pour through several turnstiles, shoving in their tokens. TV cameras have been set up to broadcast the trial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: escorts JURY MEMBERS in, checks their tickets, hands them programs and directs them to their seats. Ned and Laura sit at the defense table, next to Lana... who is oblivious to everything, deeply engrossed in a pocket video game. Ned looks toward the gallery and does a disturbed take. It's Lola!... sitting in the back row wearing a tailored suit, large brimmed hat with dark veil... and a SKUNK SKIN STOLE draped around her shoulders! Dizzy sits next to her, playing softly on a MUTED SAX.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: delivers play-by-play of the action.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What a great day for a trial! We have lots of incandescent lighting, seventy-two degrees inside... and no wind!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Oy vay! Oy vay! Superior Court of Los Angeles is now in session. And here he is... direct from a triumphant one-week engagement in Las Vegas Circuit Court... the honorable... the venerable... the totally irrepressible... Judge Harlan Skan- kyyyyyyy! Flashing "APPLAUSE" signs and flashing "ALL RISE" audience prompters. Everyone gives the Judge a standing ovation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow... has this defense team been HOT! Thirty-seven straight victories this year! Let's go down for the coin toss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bailiff flips a coin, motions to the PROSECUTOR.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The Prosecution wins the flip of the coin and elects to kick things off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The PROSECUTOR delivers her impassioned opening statement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...the prosecution will prove that this repulsive and degenerate woman coldly murdered a decent, law-abiding citizen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumps up) Objection! Move to strike. Hearsay, irrelevant, stupid, idiotic, caca- doody poo-poo...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sustained.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Laura is on the stand. Ned hands her a sheet of paper.

direction.raw_text: Ned snatches it back, pacing, folding it into a paper airplane.

direction.raw_text: Ned sails the paper plane toward the COURT CLERK, who is at an evidence table already piled high with tagged guns, appliances, knickknacks, auto parts and other junk. The plane sails toward an open window. The Clerk grabs it... going OUT the window with the plane!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And can you tell us what this is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. It's a death threat that Max Shady FAXED to you on the day he was released from prison.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: in which he threatened to puree certain parts of my anatomy in a blender! I'd like to submit this into evidence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumps up) Objection! Who cares about the FAX in this case?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll allow it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Cheerleaders lead the SPECTATORS in an exuberant CHEER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the b.g., the Court Clerk plummets to the ground, then staggers to his feet, and stumbles... dazed... back toward the courthouse.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ! You ain't got no alibi! You're ugly! Yeah, you're ugly! M-A- M-A! How you think you got that way? Your Mama! Yeah, your Mama!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bailiff reaches out, Ned waves him off... instead, tossing the blender over several heads to the Court Clerk... who runs to catch it, CRASHING into the wall. The blender falls, SHATTERS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And is this the blender you found in the lavatory of the train?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like this marked as evidence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Awwwww... a bad call by Ravine. Let's check out the re-play. On the RE-PLAY SCREEN we see the action repeated in SLOW MOTION as the Sportscaster draws lines, circles, x's and squiggles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look at THAT! The Bailiff is wide open! But instead of handing it off, Ravine goes for the long bomb. Ohhhh! The pass is wide! A real wobbler! There's no way! He scrambles, but he just can't get his hands on it... And RIGHT THERE!... (freezes the frame) ...WHAM! That blender is gone!

direction.raw_text: At the defense table, Laura glances over at Lana, who is casually browsing through a copy of GALS & GUNS magazine. Laura reacts, then, trying to be as diplomatic as possible...

direction.raw_text: They both look toward the witness stand. Ned is shaken.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ned... did you ever consider that maybe you don't know women as well as you think you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Now would you tell the court, in your own words, what you said to Mr. Ravine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers) I'm really worried about this guy. He could blow our whole case right out of the water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jeff, the little boy from the train is on the witness stand. The Prosecutor stands by, listening as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The JURORS turn pale and reach for the air sickness bags in front of them. The Courtroom erupts. The Judge pounds his gavel LOUDLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But NO ONE hears this in all the confusion. The Judge, also looking ill now, bangs his gavel again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) Great green gobs of greasy grimy gopher guts... mutilated monkey meat... itsy-bitsy birdie feet... Great green gobs of greasy grimy gopher guts... and me without a spoon!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing at Lana) That lady paid me two bucks to sing it to him...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Recess! Ten minutes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Judge, Jury, Attorneys and Spectators are all playing on the swings, teeter-totters, monkey bars... having a blast! Ned and the Prosecutor play "dodge-ball." Laura cheers Ned on. The Prosecutor rockets the ball at Ned... and just misses!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BAILIFF steps into CLOSE UP, blowing a whistle loudly!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gotcha, dork face! Gotcha, gotcha!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No you didn't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No way! Uh-uh! Missed by a mile!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Recess is over! Let's go... move it, move it, move it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Marching band MUSIC fades off-screen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There they go... the UCLA Marching Band! And now... Holy Toledo!... it looks like the victim's mother... Helen Shady... is gonna take the stand! This will be the first defensive play of the afternoon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Shady is on the stand. Ned paces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches down into her huge purse, pulling out a photo album. She opens it, showing Ned.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Shady... would you tell us about your son, Max. Was he a... a good boy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY He was the best. And that's not just a mother talking. You can ask anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he got into trouble once in awhile... like all kids do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Well, you know, pranks. Little jokes and things. But he was so cute. I have pictures!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Here. This is when he set the cat on fire... (then, assuring him) Oh... but the cat deserved it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks, points) And what, uh... what are these...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Marshmallows. He just loved to toast marshmallows over a roaring cat. Burned on the outside... all soft in the middle. (turns page) And right here... this was taken on the day he left the priesthood to join the Green Berets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They rise slowly out of their seats, craning their necks, trying to see the photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned is now seated next to Mrs. Shady in the witness box, looking at the photo album with her. Judge Skanky peers over the side of the bench.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is cute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY (laughs, delighted) Oh yes! That was during his Ku Klux Klan phase. He would take the sheets right off my bed... cut those little holes in them. What a stitch he was!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: are now on their feet, all straining to catch a glimpse of the photos in the album.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And is this Max... with all the tools... fixing his bike? She snatches the photo out of the album.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Why that shouldn't even be in there! It's his rotten little half-brother. (rips up photo) Stinkin' little pecker... he never was any good...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Sportscaster is pushing his face against the broadcast booth glass, trying to see what everyone's looking at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHADY (points at another) Oh! I didn't like these neo-Nazi boys. They were all so fussy and persnickety about everything. Heil this and heil that. (flips the page) Oh look... here's Max with his chainsaw. He loved to go to the national park and cut down those giant old trees. It made him feel so patriotic. You know, if he hadn't been such a successful criminal... I think he would have been a lumberjack. The Court Clerk, Bailiff and Court Recorder have all moved around behind the witness stand, peering over Mrs. Shady's shoulder at the photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Shady goes berserk... leaping from the witness stand, pointing several different fingers at Judge Skanky. The Bailiff attempts to restrain her, but she breaks free... scurrying around the courtroom, pointing fingers at everyone!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY (tearful, angry) But now he'll never be anything! Not since... (stands up, points) ...that woman, your wife, pulled the trigger and put my little Max in his grave!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Shady! Do not POINT your finger in my courtroom. It's discourteous, impolite and disrespectful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY Don't you tell me what to do with my finger! It's been more places than you've ever dreamed of!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bangs gavel) Sit down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SHADY I'll point my finger wherever I want!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: prevails!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Irritable Man from the train is on the stand... Max's huge cigar stuck in his ear! The hair around his ear is scorched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Man strains to see the cigar out of the corner of his eye. Impatient, Ned finally holds up a small pocket mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bailiff picks up the Irritable Man and dumps him on the evidence table, where he is tagged by the Court Clerk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you encounter the victim... Max Shady... on board the train?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. And I told him... "this is the NO SMOKING car! Would you please put out your damn cigar!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And is that the cigar in your ear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I believe it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like the cigar and the head of this witness entered into evidence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The defense calls... Lana Ravine!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lana is on the stand. The Bailiff swears her in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned and EVERY MALE in the courtroom winces at this, doubling over in imagined agony. Lana pauses, then continues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pauses to count off on her fingers, then...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you swear to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth so help you God?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks to Judge) Do I have to answer that, Harlan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no dear. I'll vouch for her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, Mrs. Ravine... may I call you Lana?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Call me Angel Tits.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I object!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sustained. Counselor... you will address Angel Tits as Mrs. Ravine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) Mrs. Ravine... would you please tell the court... what were you doing on that train?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw Max Shady at the station... saw him get on board. I knew he'd made threats to kill you and mutilate your reproductive organs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...so I got on the train too... so I could warn you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you want to have children?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Someday. With the right man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you couldn't have children if my... (makes a gesture) ...were... (another gesture) ...and, uh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It would be difficult.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you followed him, knowing you had to protect me... your husband... your best friend... the man you love... the future father of your children.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something like that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And when you saw that maniac standing in the vestibule, waiting to pulverize my pee-pee... you pulled the gun and fired and fired and FIRED!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And fired and fired and fired and fired and fired and fired and fired...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...and fired and fired and fired.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The defense rests, your Honor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The COURTROOM ARTIST has been sketching intensely throughout the trial. We finally see... he's been sketching a BOWL OF FRUIT on the Court Recorder's desk. Ned picks up some fruit from the bowl and approaches the defense table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned shoves the BANANA and two PLUMS into a demonstration blender on the defense table. He hits the puree button and the blender WHIRRS loudly!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All MALES in the courtroom react with pained expressions, cringing and doubling-over. Ned turns the blender off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How can you convict a courageous woman who risked everything to save the life of her beloved husband? A woman who acted boldly to stop a demented maniac from doing THIS!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts over) ...pulverizing the private parts of the man she loves!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (directly to Jury) Lana Ravine is a loving wife and the potential mother of my potential child. I challenge YOU to strike a blow for motherhood and the American justice system! Put the "con" back in the Constitution. Put the "ju" back in jurisprudence. Put the "can" back in American. And put the "dom" back in freedom. Find this woman INNOCENT!... so we can all go to bed happy tonight!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: opens the door marked PRESS ROOM. Inside, a DOZEN REPORTERS press their pants on a dozen ironing boards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Reporters scramble for the door, pulling their pants on!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The jury's back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The CAMERA FOLLOWS a folded piece of paper as the Jurors pass it along to the FOREMAN... who hands it to the Bailiff... who hands it to the Judge. He unfolds it, reads it... then winks flirtatiously at the FEMALE JUROR who wrote it. She blushes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (back to business) So... has the jury reached a verdict?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stands up) Yes we have, your Honor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you find the defendant... on the count of manslaughter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not guilty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the count of murder in the first degree?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not guilty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the Count of Monte Cristo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not guilty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in the court. The electronic signs FLASH "NOT GUILTY!"... "NOT GUILTY!"... "NOT GUILTY!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Jury and Spectators start to rise. The Judge hesitates, gavel poised, shooting them a warning look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone FREEZES halfway out of their seats... waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smacks his gavel. Everyone scatters for the doors, but Judge Skanky beats them out of the room. Lana turns cool, dropping her courtroom facade. She plucks off her earrings, unbuttons the neck of her dress, reaches in and magically pulls out her bra, tossing it away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good. Then on the count of three, let's all get the hell out of here! One... two...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait... for... it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two and a half... THREE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, counselor, looks like you won another case. Lucky for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sneak up behind Ned and dump a big plastic barrel of Gatorade cans over his head!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn to SEE: Spectators and Jurors browse through the clutter of junk in front of the Court Clerk on the evidence table. An IRRITABLE WOMAN claims the Irritable Man, grabbing the cigar from his ear and throwing it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulls him away as Lana steps up, with a cigarette dangling from her lips. Lana picks up her gun and spins the cylinder. It's loaded. The battered Court Clerk limps over, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura sees this... turns to Ned with a look of shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned looks off toward Lana with admiration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Lana wades into the crowd of REPORTERS, some still without pants, the CAMERA MOVES TO Lola, who is watching Lana from the back of the courtroom. Lola pulls a small cord hanging from the side of her hat... opening her veil like window drapes. She's not happy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (over P. A. system) Attention courtroom shoppers! All trial evidence now on sale. Forty to sixty percent off all exhibits! Everything must go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you, Bernard... smoking cigars is bad for your hearing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Ravine! What can I do for ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much for my gun?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't believe it! She just bought her gun back! The gun she used to kill a man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah... the same gun that saved my life. I'm sure it has sentimental value.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Frank lays on a mechanic's "creeper", working under a car. Lana steps between his feet. He hears her and rolls out, his crotch sliding to a stop against her legs. He looks up, covered with black grease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets to his feet, cocky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks toward him, her voice cold, accusing. He backs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lana pulls the gun from her purse, pointing it at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He brashly turns his back to her, putting some tools away. She sees a huge electric powered SCREWDRIVER on the workbench next to her, smiling diabolically. She lowers the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He laughs arrogantly... starts to unbutton his shirt.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So... you did it. Ya beat the rap.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No thanks to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey... I knew he'd spring ya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't lift a finger, Frank. You let me take all the heat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heeeee-eeey... what could I do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were gonna let me rot in the slammer... never say a thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look... you're out... free. Now we're together. That's what counts. We can try again! Forget triple indemnity. We'll whack him and split three mil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not splitting anything, Frank. (cocks the gun) And you know too much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (arrogant) Come on, Lana. You're not gonna shoot me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right. (then, seductive) Maybe I'll just screw you to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now you're talkin' baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We see Lana's SILHOUETTE on the window as she raises the big power screwdriver and turns it on. WHIRR-R-R-R-R-R-R-R-R-R! The CAMERA WHIPS AROUND and PUSHES IN TO...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watching the murder from her car. There is a... FLASH! Then another! And another! We are...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes FLASH pictures of the crime scene. The CORONER, COPS, FORENSIC MEN... all do their thing. Ned and Arch amble in, looking around. Arch is eating Nachos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Throughout this scene, in the b.g., the milling COPS and INVESTIGATORS slip on all the blood, as if on slick ice, and fall out of frame, their arms and legs flailing helplessly! One of the Coroner's INVESTIGATORS approaches Arch and Ned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds up a rolled piece of paper with a pair of tweezers. Ned takes it, trying to unroll it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned hands it off to Arch, who casually unrolls it. The Investigator slips, arms waving, and falls out of frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arch gives Ned a very strange look. Ned feels his stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the b.g., various COPS pair up to have their pictures taken by the Police Crime Scene Photographer... posing, grinning.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Watch your step, guys. There's a lot of blood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Looks like a suicide. We found a note.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was stuck up his nose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading it)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: can't take it anymore. I'm a mediocre mechanic... and a lousy lover."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's sure got that right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The "mechanic" part, I mean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stares at the body) I don't know why, Arch, but I just can't shake this crazy hunch it wasn't suicide.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: behind Ned on his line, revealing Frank... pinned to the wall by the power screwdriver stuck in his back! It's still running... vibrating with a GRINDING HUM. Ned reaches out and turns the screwdriver OFF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned enters, pausing. He hears VOICES. He goes to the living room. Lana and Lola turn to see him in the doorway. He is shocked. Lana looks shaken. But Lola is cool... in control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Lola.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns to Lana with a cold and contemptuous glare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola exits. As soon as the door closes, Lana whirls around in a fury!... SMASHING a lamp! She SHRIEKS furiously!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts his arms around her, comforting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kisses her and exits. Lana turns to look up toward the landing, a vengefully insane smile clouding her face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... uh, Ned... This is Lola, um...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nervous, defensive) Um? She told you her name was Um? And what other lies did she tell you? I've never seen this woman in my life! Never followed her home! Never had sex with her in the refrigerator! It's all a sick fantasy... and I deny everything!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When will women like you learn, you can't tear apart a perfectly good marriage with your vicious lies... Miss UMMMM!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually... it's Smith. Lola Smith. I sell vacuum cleaners, Mr. Ravine. The big powerful kind that suck up everything in sight. I was just telling your wife, if she wants to get rid of all her dirt, she has to be willing to pay the price.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me know what you decide, Mrs. Ravine. I'm sure we can work out a convenient "payment" plan. A pleasure meeting you... Ned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... hate... SALESMEN!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know it's been a tough ordeal... with the trial and everything. Tell you what... let's take a trip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A trip?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Just the two of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (darkly inspired) I like that. Just you and me... all alone. I'll start packing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Great. Listen... I got something to take care of. I'll be back in awhile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A demanding KNOCK at the door. Lola hesitates at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door CRASHES OPEN! Ned is silhouetted in the doorway. He looks really pissed! Lola turns and runs. Ned sprints after her, leaping through the air... bringing her down with a tackle!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her foot shoots out, smashing him right in the face... WHAM! She jumps up and scrambles away. Ned pursues her. She grabs a bottle of scotch from the counter, spins around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She throws the bottle! He ducks and it shatters on the wall!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She whirls on one foot, nailing him in the head with a FLYING SPIN KICK! He stumbles back, dazed. She grabs an ice pick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola charges! Ned rolls onto his back, jamming both feet into her stomach, heaving her up over him... thru the air! She SLAMS into the wall!... then slowly turns... still cool and collected. She raises a cigarette... lights it with the ice pick "lighter."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shoves her against the wall... the cigarette flying away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs her by the shoulders, shaking her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She clams up. He slaps her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He raises his hand to slap her hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She SLAPS him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She continues to slap him... back and forth... repeating her answers... "She's your wife"... "She's my sister!"... "Your wife!"... "My sister!"... "Wife!"... "Sister!" He reaches a boiling point, raising two fingers, preparing to give her the Three Stooges "two-fingered eye poke." She blocks it with her hand and shoves him away. Then, she executes a perfect Three Stooges "wiggly-hand head slap", telling him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned is stunned. MUSIC THUNDERS dramatically! Lana clicks the stereo off. The MUSIC STOPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She comes toward him... feeling in control once more.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just want to talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't you say so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like a drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No thanks. I'm driving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then let's get to the point!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what's your problem, tough guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stay away from my life, my wife, my home and my pets! I'm taking Lana on a vacation and when I come back, I don't ever want to see your face again!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! She doesn't deserve a VACATION! She's a brat! A bad girl! She always was and always will be!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about? You don't know anything about Lana?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know EVERYTHING!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes her hard) How do you know her? Who is she to you? TELL ME!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who is she!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's your wife!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slaps her again!) Who is she!?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's my sister!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slaps her again) Liar! Who is she?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's your wife!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's my sister!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's your wife... AND my sister!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She was spoiled rotten! She stole everything I ever had. Everything! Including him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Him? Who, him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dwayne. The boy's gym teacher. He was older. So mature... so strong. He smelled like dirty sweat socks and old basketballs. And he was all mine. For awhile. (turning bitter) But Lana wasn't satisfied with her own things. She had to have mine too. She took it all... my makeup, my sweaters, my shoes, my underwear...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wore the same clothes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were identical twins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're you talking about? You two don't look anything alike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not anymore. One day I caught her stealing my lavender eye shadow and she smashed my face in with a shovel. I had fifty-three operations. When the doctors were finished with me... I looked like THIS! I'm ugly. UGLY!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't lie to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They did a terrific job!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I look in the mirror. I can SEE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But... you're gorgeous!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell that to Dwayne. When he saw my face, he left me for HER... because she looked more like me than I did! First she stole my looks... then she stole the only man who ever loved me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I found a way to get even. The best revenge possible. Destroy her marriage!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's why you did all this? Seduced me... harrassed me... the tape... the flowers... the phone calls...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You been hangin' out with Dick Tracy, haven't ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It won't work. Lana loves me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It doesn't matter. I'm blackmailing her for everything she's worth. She murdered that greasy auto mechanic. I saw her do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stunned) Lana killed Frank Kelbo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (also stunned) Kelbo! His name was Kelbo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Why? Did he burn you on car repairs too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dwayne's name was Kelbo. He had a son. Frankie Kelbo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned wanders to his car, climbs in, sits there... stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned rubs his temples, shuts his eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The pieces of the puzzle were falling into place and I didn't like the picture they were making. If Lana really killed Frank Kelbo, then I had misjudged her by a mile. Sure... he was a lousy mechanic. But murder?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It was all starting to give me a headache bigger than the national deficit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: n-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" plays on the stereo. Lola sits on the floor by an end table, eyes dazed, staring blankly. A lamp with a "clapper" switch sits on the table. As the CAMERA MOVES IN SLOWLY to her, she absently "claps" the light off... then on... then off... then on... then off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON female hands using a keyhole saw to cut through a railing on the second floor landing above the foyer. Outside... the SOUND of a car... headlights! The sawing stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned pulls up. The house is dark and ominous. So is the MUSIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The front door is open a crack. He cautiously pushes it and the door CR-E-A-K-S open very slowly. The door STOPS, but the LOUD CREAKING continues. Ned touches it lightly with the tip of his finger. The CREAKING STOPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned moves up the stairs. The CAMERA BOOMS UP with him, HOLDING ON an ECU of the partially severed railing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lana?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned enters. Hot water gushes from the faucet into a clawfoot bathtub. He turns the water off, looking around, puzzled. Loosens his tie, rubs his head. A splitting headache. Opens the medicine cabinet and... SCREECH! YEOW! CRASH! A CAT leaps out!... darts away. There's a NOISE from downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone is POUNDING on the door. Ned enters and opens it. It's Laura.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She drags a chair in behind her, sits at the kitchen table. Ned puts a kettle on the burner, turns it on. He starts searching through the cupboard for teabags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned freezes, staring out the window, unable to face her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned turns to her when he hears Lola's name... looking baffled by this convoluted piece of logic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns back to the cupboard, picking up a container.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He brings the Ovaltine container to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A huge ceramic cookie jar sits on the table in front of them. Laura SMASHES it with her fist, breaking it open! Cookies spill out... and the insurance policy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sits down... starts eating Oreos... twisting them apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She unrolls a complex genealogical chart... walks him thru it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura pauses dramatically, then announces.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ned! I'm glad you're here. I have so much to tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on in. I'll make some tea. Grab a chair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks... I brought my own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So... what have you got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A lottery ticket and a laundry receipt. (lays them on table) I found them in the pocket of that suit you wore the night you were working under cover with a client.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You remember that night, don't ya Ned? Then it hit me. Lottery starts with L-O. Laundry starts with L-A. L- O... L-A. Lola.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs it off) Don't sweat it. It's the way a woman's mind works.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about Ovaltine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine. Then I remembered you told me some guy named Frank had been working on your wife's car for two months. You with me so far?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm way ahead of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well back it up. You probably took a wrong turn. Remember your insurance policy... the one we couldn't find? I started thinking, who else had access to it beside you and me? The answer came up... Lana. And since she's a woman, it's probably hidden right here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So that's where she hid the Oreos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ned, Lana wasn't trying to save your life when she shot Max Shady. She and Frank were plotting to kill you and collect on your insurance policy. But she shot the wrong guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the craziest thing I ever heard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (she presses on) Don't you see... Frank was going to let her take the fall. So she murdered him and tried to make it look like suicide. (beat) That's when I realized there was a connection between Lola and Lana...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah... they're sisters. Twin sisters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, hang on to your jock strap, Ned. There's more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not only is Frank's father Dwayne Kelbo, notoriously amorous gym teacher and Lola Cain's former lover... Frank's mother is Helen Shady. Max and Frank are half-brothers who never met.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your lovely wife, Lana, murdered both of Helen Shady's sons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is so unbelievable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you haven't even heard my story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The keyhole saw cuts through the railing. The CAMERA REVEALS Lana, eyes filled with Machiavellian rage. She enters the bathroom, lays the saw blade down. Suddenly... a PAIR OF HANDS plunge into frame, grabbing her by the throat! We GO WITH HER as she is pushed back into the tub, the hands forcing her head under water. Lana grabs a diving mask, clamps it over her face. One of the attacking hands rips it away! Lana grabs a snorkel, sticking it in her mouth. The hand pulls it from her, tossing it aside. The hand shoves a little RUBBER DUCKIE into Lana's mouth! Lana struggles, finally going limp. Her open eyes stare up from beneath the water. The last few bubbles rise to the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turned into a monster. And that's when I left him. I just couldn't... The tea kettle WHISTLES! Laura pulls it off the burner. The whistling subsides... replaced by the distant SOUND of water running upstairs. Ned cocks his head, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned exits. Laura opens the Ovaltine container. It's empty. A DARK SHADOW moves past the window behind Laura. Suspense MUSIC. Laura opens the cupboard. PIGEONS explode out, wings beating furiously! She catches her breath, looks in the cupboard. The cans and boxes are covered with pigeon shit. She shoves them aside, looking for the Ovaltine.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That damn faucet keeps turning on all by itself. I'll go check it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. I'll make the Ovaltine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned looks up toward the light from the bathroom. Water seeps over the edge of the landing and down the steps. As he moves up the steps, the SOUND of MUSIC... the familiar strains of "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida"... grows louder and LOUDER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's filled with steam. He waves the steam away... STARTLED to see Lana's lifeless body beneath the water, the rubber duckie jammed into her mouth. The tub overflows on the floor. He turns the faucet off. The water stops... and so does the MUSIC. Puzzled, he turns the faucet on. The MUSIC STARTS. Turns it off. The MUSIC STOPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Laura turns away to enter the pantry... her Husband's twisted face suddenly appears in the kitchen window!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned enters. The MUSIC is coming from the closet. Ned yanks the door open! A flock of PIGEONS bursts out!... revealing a GUEST MUSICIAN playing an instrument.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned shuts the door, eyes shifting. Lola must be near.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sittin' in for Dizzy. He had a gig tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PANTRY OFF KITCHEN - SAME TIME Laura searches the large walk-in pantry for tea bags. She hears a LOUD CRASH of BREAKING GLASS in the kitchen... stops and listens... then casually shrugs it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura's Husband stands in the kitchen. The back door is open... the window shattered. He SEES... the kitchen towels hanging sloppily on the rack! The disorganized clutter of cans and boxes in the cupboard! WE PUSH IN to his wildly insane eyes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Ned enters the upstairs landing, we hear VOICES in his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The repetitive ECHO gets to him. He smacks his head with the palm of his hand. The skipping stops... followed by...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (ECHOING V.O.) Women are an open book. You can always tell the rotten apples from the peaches. I'd stake my career on it... stake my career on it... stake my career on it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ECHOING V.O.) ...If anyone ever proves me wrong, I'll throw away my badge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A woman's HAND unrolls a leather kit... the "U-Pick an Ice Pick Porta-Pik-Pak!"... with seven ice picks in separate slots, each labeled with a day of the week. The hand selects "Wednesday's" ice pick, pulls it out. Then... BONG... BONG... BONG... BONG...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - A GRANDFATHER CLOCK It CHIMES loudly. It's twelve midnight!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: returns the ice pick to its slot, selects the one for Thursday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura comes out of the pantry. She stops... gasps! Everything in the cupboard is neatly stacked! All the towels are straight! She whirls around... coming face to face with her Husband! He smiles demonically, holding up the Ninja Turtle float ring.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Forget something, sweetheart?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned nears the bathroom door and suddenly... A PIERCING SCREAM! Lola charges, an ice pick raised over her head! She knocks him backward, into the bathroom, slashing at him. But he deflects the attack, grabbing at her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura backs away from her Husband. He holds her wedding ring.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You forgot to flush, darling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Ned and Lola continue their violent struggle... Lola grabs toiletries to aid in her attack. She squirts Ned with SHAVING CREAM... squeezes TOOTHPASTE in his hair... and throws BATH POWDER in his face! Ned is blinded. Gaining the advantage, Lola shoves him back, slamming his head into the wall. He's dazed, helpless. Lola raises the ice pick, moving forward to strike! But Ned grabs a HAIR BLOWER and swings it around, pointing it at her like a gun! She freezes... then smiles contemptuously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She LAUGHS arrogantly. Ned clicks on the hair blower to HIGH, a blast of HOT AIR hitting Lola's face, puffing her cheeks out, pushing her back, hair flying wildly! Her backside hits the railing where Lana has cut it... the wood splintering! Lola tumbles over backward, SCREAMING! She hangs suspended in mid-air for a moment, like a cartoon character, arms flailing. Then... WHOOM!... she FALLS to the marble floor below, hitting with a LOUD THUD!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What're you gonna do, Ned? Blow me away?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Laura's Husband hears Lola fall, turning. Laura grabs the iron skillet and CLOBBERS him with it! BONG! He goes down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I never forget anything... honey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned stares at the hair blower in his hand. Filled with disgust and revulsion, he throws the "weapon" down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura pulls TWO REVOLVERS from her purse... spinning them like John Wayne... expertly tossing one over her back, catching it in front! She heads for the foyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A MOMENT LATER - ON LOLA'S BODY Laura pauses, looks down at Lola's body... notices something. She pushes Lola's skirt a bit higher with the toe of her shoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up... sees a light emanating from the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (outraged) Those are MY panties!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Laura moves through the shadows... stops outside the bathroom, pressing her back against the wall, guns up and ready. She swivels into the doorway... taking a shooter's stance... guns pointed! She sees... LANA... submerged in the tub, face up, the rubber duckie in her mouth. Laura steps back and turns... right into a THING covered in white! Startled, she SHRIEKS! Ned drops the white towel he's using to wipe off all of the shaving cream and toothpaste. Relieved to see it's Ned, she throws her arms around him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls out his police badge, looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tosses it away, over the railing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Ned!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were right... there's a million things I don't know about women. Maybe you can teach me a few hundred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hell... I had too many careers anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The badge drops from above, landing on the floor right in front of Lola's lifeless face. A beat. Her eyes pop open!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, the rubber duckie pops to the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura hugs Ned again, arms locked around his neck, still gripping a gun in each hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Ned, I love you. I always loved you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lola sits bolt upright, bloody but still bouncy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lana suddenly SITS UP in the tub, inhaling a huge GASP of air, her eyes wild!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura's Husband's eyes POP OPEN! He SITS UP suddenly... smashing his head into the sharp corner of the kitchen table! He topples back slowly... really dead! Finally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lola's feet move steadily up each stair... her bloody hand grasping the ice pick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lana's feet step out of the tub, water dripping all around. She picks up the pointed saw from the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ned and Laura still embrace, her forearms crisscrossed behind his neck. It's been a long embrace. Suddenly, Lana and Lola both appear, SCREAMING like banshees! Lana charges from the bathroom, grasping the sharp saw blade! Lola races at them from the stairway... with the ice pick! Without missing a beat, Laura raises the barrels of both guns and FIRES at them simultaneously... right next to Ned's ears. The impact of one bullet knocks Lana all the way back through the bathroom, CRASHING spectacularly out the window! The other bullet sends Lola flipping down the staircase! Ned looks stunned, his eyes crossed... the thundering gunshots still ringing in his ears. Laura proudly blows the gunsmoke away from the end of each barrel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He strains to make out what she's saying, ears still ringing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat. Laura opens her mouth to correct him, then decides against it. She smiles... speaking softly, almost shyly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hears THIS... smiles at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They embrace.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Got 'em!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (deafened)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said... I GOT 'EM!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yells)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! GONE! KA-PUT!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yells back)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! NEXT TUESDAY WOULD BE PERFECT!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. But I want to have kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We MOVE IN SLOWLY toward the house.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) So... maybe I was wrong. Maybe women really are like a big jigsaw puzzle... with pieces that never seem to fit where you want 'em to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ned and Laura are in bed, wrapped in each other's arms.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) All I know is, there are three things that men can't possibly ever do...
dialogue.name: dialogue
